content.html:
• This has been a delicious and expensive week.
  • Lots of Terraform this week. I mean lots. Terraform is one of my favorite things in tech right now because it’s a single, simple declarative language for describing nearly everything.
  • Amazing Thai food for dinner on Monday in Ebisu.
  • Had a few unexpected interesting conversations at work.
  • Taking advantage of a few circumstances from recent weeks, I am going deep on self-improvement and have upgraded my 7-year-old Apple Watch, bought sweat-proof fitness earphones, procured more kitchen equipment - and finally - obtained a dining table. Phew.
  • Skipped papers club to go to a sauna for the first time in months. My heat tolerance has dipped a lot, but that’s OK, I’ll get back there.
  • We have found the best Tacos in Tokyo. It is a closely guarded secret so I can’t advertise it, but ask me and I will take you there.
  • In words never uttered by a human before: I had a fun dental appointment. And I’m going in for a much longer session later this month which I’m excited about.
  • Harry really knows how to make a sandwich. God damn.
  • At the weekend I went to a friend’s house for wagyu and to learn how to make sushi. It was all tasty, and towards the end of the day we started getting creative with the fusion, resulting in an unholy combination of wagyu, sushi and doritos. Reader: It worked.
  • Sunday evening marks the start of a days-long experiment involving yeast. Wish me luck.
content.excerpt: This has been a delicious and expensive week. Lots of Terraform this week.  I mean lots.  Terraform is one of my favorite things in tech…
